message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest pelvic inflammatory disease (PID). However, given the severity of the symptoms, including the high fever and hypotension, this patient likely has a complicated PID with potential abscess formation or ruptured infection. Therefore, exploratory laparotomy is the most appropriate definitive treatment. Antibiotics can be started empirically with a combination of levofloxacin and metronidazole, but this would only be a temporizing measure until definitive treatment can be provided. Single-dose ceftriaxone IM and clindamycin + gentamicin × 14 days are not appropriate for a patient with a complicated PID.
